business.headline: Bengaluru's PG crisis: What's behind the mass shutdowns?Once the lifeline for Bengaluru's migrant workforce, why are PGs now vanishing from the city's tech hubs at an alarming pace? Read on know why hundreds of PG accommodations have shut down in the city.
Sensex opens 100 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; NTPC gains 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 68.34 points to 82,513.55, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 19.40 points to 25,128.05 as of 9:25 am.
Hiring plans steady in India Inc for Q2 FY26: ReportIndia ranked second globally, behind the UAE, which reported the strongest hiring sentiment. India reported a Net Employment Outlook (NEO) of 42%.

Stock market opening today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyThe Sensex and Nifty are likely to extend their gains, helped by improving hopes around global trade discussions and the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) policy measures.

Stocks to watch on June 10: Wipro, Tech Mahindra, Motilal Oswal, Premier EnergiesSensex and Nifty rose nearly half a percent in the last session, driven by favourable trends in both domestic and global markets.

Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

Warner Bros Discovery to become two separate companies: ReportThe decision comes as more people stop watching traditional TV and move to streaming platforms. This shift has forced many media companies to rethink how they work.

Your Rs 1 crore flat is now Rs 90 lakh: Investor explains why value is shrinkingA financial influencer warns that unchecked money printing and currency devaluation could be reducing the real value of properties and other assets, urging investments in inflation-resistant assets.

Pakistan's economy set to grow 2.7% in FY25: ReportPakistan's central bank, in a bid to encourage growth, cut its policy rate by more than 1,000 basis points in the current fiscal year. Its latest cut last month brought the key rate to 11%, resuming an easing cycle that had brought rates down from 22% after a brief pause in March.
Sensex settles over 200 points; Nifty above 25,100; Kotak Bank gains 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 256.22 points to close at 82,445.21, while the NSE Nifty50 added 100.20 points to end at 25,103.20.

Who is Sashidhar Jagdishan? HDFC Bank CEO under financial fraud lensSashidhar Jagdishan has been a part of HDFC Bank since 1996. He joined as a manager in the finance division and quickly rose through the ranks.

Shein, Reliance aim to sell India-made clothes globally within a year: ReportThe aim is to make Shein-branded clothes in India not just for local sales but also for international markets, starting with the US and UK, within the next 6 to 12 months.

entertainment.headline: Amanda Seyfried accuses Paramount of owing her money for Mean Girls merchandiseActor Amanda Seyfried has revealed that she has not received royalties from Paramount Pictures for 'Mean Girls' merchandise featuring her image. The issue extends to other cast members, raising concerns about unpaid earnings from the popular 2004 teen film.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

BTS are back: What to expect from the return of Kings of K-popBTS members have started returning from military service, marking the end of a long hiatus and sparking excitement across the K-pop world. HYBE shares have surged as fans and investors anticipate a major comeback and global tour.

Thug Life box office Day 5: Is Kamal Haasan's film heading towards a disaster?Kamal Haasan and director Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life' is struggling to strike big at the box office. The film recorded its lowest Monday collection ever.

BTS' RM and V complete military service, promise album and concerts 'real soon'BTS members RM and V are now back after serving their mandatory military service. They expressed their desire to return to the stage after releasing an album 'real soon.'

New faces join Harry Potter HBO series: Meet the Malfoys, Dursleys, and moreHBO reveals nine new cast members for its upcoming Harry Potter TV series, promising a faithful adaptation of The Sorcerer's Stone. The series will stream exclusively on Max in multiple countries.

Sly Stone, groundbreaking musician behind 'Family Affair,' dies in Los AngelesSly Stone, iconic frontman of Sly and the Family Stone, died at 82. Known for revolutionizing funk and promoting unity through music, his influence shaped decades of American sound and culture.

Diddy's ex-girlfriend recounts trauma in wake of Cassie's abuse claimsDiddy's ex-girlfriend broke down in court, saying Cassie's abuse lawsuit mirrored her own trauma. She testified about coerced sex, emotional abuse, and threats linked to her housing and relationship with Combs.

Judge dismisses Justin Baldoni's $400 million defamation lawsuit against Blake LivelyA US judge dismissed Justin Baldoni's $650 million lawsuits against Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds, and others, ruling insufficient evidence of defamation. A separate trial between Baldoni and Lively begins in 2026.

Frederick Forsyth, author of 'The Day of the Jackal, dies at 86Frederick Forsyth, bestselling author of The Day of the Jackal, died at 86. A former RAF pilot and journalist, he secretly aided MI6 and leaves behind a legacy of iconic thrillers.

Akhanda 2 teaser out: Nandamuri Balakrishna's action saga set for September releaseDirected by Boyapati Sreenu, the sequel to the 2021 Telugu blockbuster film 'Akhanda' stars Nandamuri Balakrishna in the lead. Titled 'Akhanda 2: Thaandavam', the film also stars Samyuktha Menon and Aadhi Pinisetty in prominent roles.

Ed Sheeran praises Arijit Singh's Tum Hi Ho in heartfelt post: I was spellboundEnglish singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran recently shared a heartwarming note dedicated to Arijit Singh. Apart from cherishing his experience of scooter rides with Arjit, Ed also praised 'Tum Hi Ho' from 'Aashiqui 2'.

Actor Ravi Mohan's rumoured partner Keneeshaa reacts to pregnancy rumoursActor Ravi Mohan's rumoured partner, Keneeshaa Francis, has reacted to the speculations over her alleged pregnancy. Keneeshaa revealed the truth behind the picture which led to the pregnancy claims.

It's a wrap for Karthi, Malavika Mohanan starrer Sardar 2: What an adventureDirected by PS Mithran, 'Sardar 2' is the sequel to the 2022 blockbuster, with Tamil actor Karthi reprising his dual roles, along with Malavika Mohanan and SJ Suryah. The team recently wrapped the shooting.

Metro In Dino's heartbreak anthem Dil Ka Kya reminds fans of KKAnurag Basu's 'Metro...In Dino' releases its second song, 'Dil Ka Kya' highlighting emotional storytelling. The song reminded fans of the late singer KK

Khushi Kapoor, Vedang Raina steal the spotlight at Sonam Kapoor's birthday bashActors Khushi Kapoor and Vedang Raina were seen engaged in a private conversation at Sonam Kapoor's birthday bash. The dating rumours between the couple started after their debut film, The Archies.'

Asha Negi on Criminal Justice 4, admiring Tabu, Sakshi Tanwar's journeyActor Asha Negi, in an interview with IndiaToday.in, shared her experience of working on 'Criminal Justice 4.' She also spoke about playing the girl-next-door and her admiration for Tabu and Sakshi Tanwar.

Salman-SRK's Tiger vs Pathaan on hold as YRF revamps spy universe: ReportSalman Khan and Shah Rukh Khan's 'Tiger Vs Pathaan' has not been shelved but put on hold as YRF seeks to revamp its spy universe, suggested media reports. The makers are trying to add a fresh direction and innovative storytelling styles to the film.

They decide the date, not us: Kuberaa producer slams OTT's growing control'Kuberaa' producer Suniel Narang revealed that when a July release date was requested, the OTT platform insisted on the original date of June 20, warning that any delay would result in a Rs 10 crore cut from the agreed amount.

general news.headline: 700 US Marines land in LA as California sues Trump over guard deploymentAs the protests enter their fourth day, the deployment of 700 marines in Los Angeles, described as temporary, is intended to support National Guard forces already on the ground. Meanwhile, California has sued the Trump administration, calling the federal deployment unlawful.

Trump's old clip on governor's nod for National Guard is viral amid California rowAmid rising tensions between Donald Trump and California Democrats over his administration's deployment of more than 4,100 National Guard members, the US President is seen saying that his administration can't call in the National Guards unless the governor of a state requests them in an old video.

India Today sting op exposes bribe-for-treatment racket at Lucknow hospitalsA sting operation by India Today TV has exposed rampant corruption and malpractices at Lucknow's government hospitals, including Balrampur Hospital and Shyama Prasad Mukherjee Civil Hospital.

Amid riots, JD Vance's meme threat to deport fashion critic who hates his suitsAmid Los Angeles immigration raids, US fashion influencer Derek Guy revealed he is undocumented, prompting Vice President JD Vance to respond with a meme which many saw as a thinly veiled deportation threat.

Racist hate after Meghalaya honeymoon murder: Northeast people demand apologyAfter the body of Raja Raghuvanshi, a man from Indore on his honeymoon, was found in Meghalaya, and his wife was untraceable, some people started a racist campaign against the state and the Northeast region. After it emerged that the wife was behind his murder, people from the Northeast were demanding an apology for being vilified.

May shut down services if...: Goa doctor berated by minister rejects apologyGoa Health Minister Vishwajit Rane apologised for publicly berating Rudresh Kuttikar, the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of the Goa Medical College, after he received a complaint that the medic refused to treat an elderly patient.

Dhoni's priceless reaction to ICC Hall of Fame honor: I will cherish it foreverLegendary India captain MS Dhoni was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame amongst six other players. Dhoni said that it was a huge honour to join a club full of legends, and he will cherish it forever.

WWDC 2025: From iOS 26 to Liquid Glass, here is everything Apple announcedApple unveiled major software updates across all platforms at WWDC 2025, introducing the Liquid Glass design, unified version numbers, new AI tools, and upgraded experiences on iPhone, iPad, Mac, Watch, and Vision Pro.

Can Bangladesh trust Yunus's April 2026 poll promise?As murmurs of public support were amplified by Yunus's camp, Bangladesh's interim government finds itself under pressure from political parties and the military to hold elections this year, not delay democracy.

Biological smuggling: US arrests Chinese scientist linked to Wuhan labChinese Ph.D. student Chengxuan Han was arrested in Detroit for allegedly smuggling roundworm-related biological materials into the US and lying to federal agents, amid growing scrutiny of CCP-linked researchers.

Bengaluru's PG crisis: What's behind the mass shutdowns?Once the lifeline for Bengaluru's migrant workforce, why are PGs now vanishing from the city's tech hubs at an alarming pace? Read on know why hundreds of PG accommodations have shut down in the city.

California Governor accuses Trump of sending troops to LA without food, shelterCalifornia Governor Gavin Newsom accused Donald Trump of sending National Guard troops to Los Angeles without food, water, or shelter. He called the move disrespectful and shared images of troops sleeping on floors.

How Kamal Haasan's Thug Life failed its women: Trisha, Abhirami, Aishwarya LekshmiDirector Mani Ratnam's 'Thug Life', starring Kamal Haasan and Silambarasan, has been receiving mixed reviews from critics and audiences. However, the biggest injustice was meted out to the women in the film, played by Trisha Krishnan, Abhirami and Aishwarya Lekshmi.

Man eats non-veg inside Annamalai temple premises in Tamil Nadu, sparks tensionsA man was found eating non-vegetarian food inside the famous Annamalai temple premises in Tamil Nadu's Thiruvannamalai, triggering outrage amongst devotees. He was taken into custody for questioning.

IISc professor salutes unsung heroes as support pours in for Chenab Bridge successDr G Madhavi Latha said that thousands of people have contributed significantly to the construction of the iconic Chenab Rail Bridge and she salutes their efforts.

How Elon Musk is responding to LA riots amid feud with Donald TrumpElon Musk backed Trump's decision to deploy the National Guard amid LA riots, despite their recent feud over the "Big Beautiful Bill," calling the protests violent and reposting anti-riot messages on X.

Bengaluru stampede: Celebration without control, accountability without actionThe chaos in Bengaluru during Royal Challengers Bengaluru's (RCB) IPL victory parade stands as a stark reminder of the consequences of administrative complacency.

Shubhanshu Shukla launch postponed: When will his Ax-4 mission take off?The mission, which has been postponed due to bad weather, is now expected to take off on June 11 or 12, as there is a 45 per cent chance of rainfall and strong winds at the launch centre.

Car hangs mid-air from unfinished flyover in UP, occupants escape unhurtA car heading from Nepal towards Gorakhpur ended up hanging mid-air from the edge of an under-construction flyover on National Highway 24 in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj district. Google Maps show no indication of a flyover at the site where the incident happened.

Operation Bluestar: Is a quiet anniversary a turning point in Sikh politics?The Akal Takht's silence on June 6 signalled a fractured Sikh polity, a disillusioned youth, a contested past—and perhaps a chance for a reset

Amanda Seyfried accuses Paramount of owing her money for Mean Girls merchandiseActor Amanda Seyfried has revealed that she has not received royalties from Paramount Pictures for 'Mean Girls' merchandise featuring her image. The issue extends to other cast members, raising concerns about unpaid earnings from the popular 2004 teen film.

Rs 33,000 per device, Rs 3,000 monthly post-trial: Starlink's India entry planStarlink customers will need to purchase a satellite dish-essential hardware for accessing the service-at an estimated cost of Rs 33,000. The monthly unlimited data plan will be offered at Rs 3,000.

Pakistan's debt increased to PKR 76,000 billion, economic survey revealsFinance Minister Muhammad Aurangzeb, who released the Economic Survey 2024-25 Monday, said Pakistan's economy has been on the path to recovery for the last two years, and the process was further stabilised and strengthened in the current fiscal year.

Lizard found in ice-cream in Punjab, vendor keeps selling despite confrontationA 7-year-old boy found a dead lizard in his ice cream purchased from a local street vendor in Punjab's Ludhiana. Even after concerned locals confronted him, the vendor defended himself and continued selling ice cream.

sports.headline: KL Rahul A+, Yashasvi Jaiswal D: Report card of Indian stars in India A vs England LionsThe Indian stars got some good time in the middle during the India A vs England Lions series ahead of the start of the Test tour. While some impressed, others failed to make a mark as India get set for the first Test against England, starting on June 20.

Dhoni's priceless reaction to ICC Hall of Fame honor: I will cherish it foreverLegendary India captain MS Dhoni was inducted into the ICC Hall of Fame amongst six other players. Dhoni said that it was a huge honour to join a club full of legends, and he will cherish it forever.

Hayden, Graeme Smith, Hashim Amla among others inducted in ICC Hall of FameThe International Cricket Council (ICC) announced seven new inductees into the Hall of Fame, namely Graeme Smith, Matthew Hayden, Hashim Amla, Daniel Vettori, MS Dhoni, Sarah Taylor and Sana Mir.

Australia's road to WTC Final: How Pat Cummins' side dominated in all conditionsAustralia take on South Africa in the World Test Championship final in Lord's. The defending champions have once again underlined their red-ball supremacy by reaching the final of the ICC World Test Championship 2023–25 cycle.

At 29, West Indies star Nicholas Pooran announces shock retirementWest Indies batter Nicholas Pooran announced his retirement from international cricket at 29. His decision reflects a growing trend of players prioritising lucrative T20 leagues over national duty.

Anderson relishing huge honour as England vs India Test series gets renamedThe England-India Test series will now reportedly be named as the Tendulkar-Anderson Trophy. Legendary past bowler James Anderson reacted to the development ahead of the series.

What happens if WTC final is drawn, tied or washed out?South Africa and Australia will compete in the 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. What happens in case the match is drawn or gets washed out.

Tanush Kotian flexes batting muscles as India A draw England LionsTanush Kotian and Anshul Kamboj played two big innings on the final day of the 2nd unofficial Test match in Northampton. The match highlighted strong batting performances but ended without a result, setting the tone for the upcoming series.

MS Dhoni becomes 11th Indian to be inducted into ICC Hall of FameLegendary MS Dhoni has been named as the latest inductee into the ICC Hall of Fame. Dhoni became the 11th Indian cricketer to be named in the list.

WTC Final 2025: Live streaming, timing, venue, squad detailsSouth Africa will face Australia in the highly anticipated 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. Here's everything you need to know about the match, which starts from June 11.

Steve Smith suggests WTC final tweak, excited to face worthy rivals South AfricaSpeaking to the press two days ahead of the much-anticipated World Test Championship final, Steve Smith talked up the firepower in the South African side and said he had no doubt they deserved to be in the final. Australia are bidding to become the first team to defend the Test championship crown.

What happens if WTC final is drawn, tied or washed out?South Africa and Australia will compete in the 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. What happens in case the match is drawn or gets washed out.

Tanush Kotian flexes batting muscles as India A draw England LionsTanush Kotian and Anshul Kamboj played two big innings on the final day of the 2nd unofficial Test match in Northampton. The match highlighted strong batting performances but ended without a result, setting the tone for the upcoming series.

MS Dhoni becomes 11th Indian to be inducted into ICC Hall of FameLegendary MS Dhoni has been named as the latest inductee into the ICC Hall of Fame. Dhoni became the 11th Indian cricketer to be named in the list.

WTC Final 2025: Live streaming, timing, venue, squad detailsSouth Africa will face Australia in the highly anticipated 2025 World Test Championship final at Lord's. Here's everything you need to know about the match, which starts from June 11.

Steve Smith suggests WTC final tweak, excited to face worthy rivals South AfricaSpeaking to the press two days ahead of the much-anticipated World Test Championship final, Steve Smith talked up the firepower in the South African side and said he had no doubt they deserved to be in the final. Australia are bidding to become the first team to defend the Test championship crown.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
